Package view

Class GUIController

java.lang.Object
view.GUIController
public class GUIController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller for main-windows (GUI) repaints board at distributeGameState in Game_Impl

      public void callMenuExitAction()
      menu-call 'Game' > 'Close' Closes Application by menu-call. possible hook to save some important information before closing!

      menu-call 'Game' > 'Game Settings' Configure your game! Set Players, Colors, Names and switch KIs

    • callMenuDatabaseSettings

      public void callMenuDatabaseSettings() throws java.io.IOException
      menu-call 'Game' > 'Database Settings'

      Scene to configure database connection. Accepted DB must work like mySQL-DB

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws, if fxml file is not readable

    • autoCallMenuDatabaseSettings

      public void autoCallMenuDatabaseSettings​(boolean isAutoCall) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets called directly by system - hence isAutoCall = true (if not called by callMenuDatabaseSettings)
      Parameters:
      isAutoCall - This specifies if the method got called by system or user (isAutoCall == true when called by system)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws, if fxml file is not readable

    • setDatabaseAccess

      public void setDatabaseAccess​(DatabaseAccess dbAccess)
      Sets the Database Access at program launch that will be used for the entire time
      Parameters:
      dbAccess - The DatabaseAccess object for this instance of GUIController

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers​(java.util.HashMap<Color,​Player> players)
      Set field players and call firstPaintPlayerInformation.
      Parameters:
      players - players of game

    • callMenuVisualHelp

      public void callMenuVisualHelp()
      menu-call 'Help' > 'Show visual help'

      Changes boolean showHelp. If game is running and showHelp is set true: calls showHelpingBorders() instantly! If game is running and showHelp is set false: calls repaint() to remove highlighting!

    • showHelpingBorders

      public void showHelpingBorders()
      Generates highlighting for currently reachable tiles in following conditions:
      1. Showing Help is active (set by menu)
      2. There is a humanPlayer in game
      3. humanPlayer is ActiveColor in current gameState

      Method called by requestActionGamePiece() of PlayerPhysical

    • getDelay

      public long getDelay()

      public void changeDelay​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      method to change private member 'delay' to value of RadioMenuItem.userData
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - switched RadioMenuItem
